p: As reported by Marín et al. (2008) and Varga et al. (2010) the most employed antifungal alternative for controlling various species of Aspergillus including A. flavus is the chemically synthesized pesticides with a great variety of fungicides such as benzimidazoles and aromatic hydrocarbons, among others, and their combinations; however, the continuous application of these products increases the risk of toxic residues in the agricultural product and environment.
